question: The initial program that is run when the computer is powered up is called __________
incorrect answers: boot program
bootloader
initializer

question: How does the software trigger an interrupt?
incorrect answers: Sending signals to CPU through bus
Executing a special program called system program
Executing a special program called interrupt trigger program
correct_answer: Executing a special operation called system call

question: What is a trap/exception?
incorrect answers: hardware generated interrupt caused by an error
user generated interrupt caused by an error
none of the mentioned
correct_answer: software generated interrupt caused by an error

question: What is an ISR?
incorrect answers: Information Service Request
Interrupt Service Request
Information Service Routine

question: What is an interrupt vector?
incorrect answers: It is a unique device number that is indexed by an address
It is a unique identity given to an interrupt
None of the mentioned
correct_answer: It is an address that is indexed to an interrupt handler

question: DMA is used for __________
incorrect answers: Low speed devices
Utilizing CPU cycles
All of the mentioned
correct_answer: High speed devices(disks and communications network)

question: In a memory mapped input/output __________
incorrect answers: the CPU uses polling to watch the control bit constantly, looping to see if a device is ready
the CPU receives an interrupt when the device is ready for the next byte
the CPU runs a user written code and does accordingly
correct_answer: the CPU writes one data byte to the data register and sets a bit in control register to show that a byte is available

question: In a programmed input/output(PIO) __________
incorrect answers: the CPU writes one data byte to the data register and sets a bit in control register to show that a byte is available
the CPU receives an interrupt when the device is ready for the next byte
the CPU runs a user written code and does accordingly
correct_answer: the CPU uses polling to watch the control bit constantly, looping to see if a device is ready

question: In an interrupt driven input/output __________
incorrect answers: the CPU uses polling to watch the control bit constantly, looping to see if a device is ready
the CPU writes one data byte to the data register and sets a bit in control register to show that a byte is available
the CPU runs a user written code and does accordingly
correct_answer: the CPU receives an interrupt when the device is ready for the next byte

question: In the layered approach of Operating Systems __________
incorrect answers: Bottom Layer(0) is the User interface
Bottom Layer(N) is the hardware
Highest Layer(N) is the hardware
correct_answer: Highest Layer(N) is the User interface

question: How does the Hardware trigger an interrupt?
incorrect answers: Executing a special program called interrupt program
Executing a special program called system program
Executing a special operation called system call
correct_answer: Sending signals to CPU through a system bus

question: Which operation is performed by an interrupt handler?
incorrect answers: Saving the current state of the system
Loading the interrupt handling code and executing it
Once done handling, bringing back the system to the original state it was before the interrupt occurred
